content.body: Domenic: what defines that `:root, :--blah { background:lime }` suddenly works if not a change to Selectors?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: what defines that :root, :--blah { background:lime } suddenly works if not a change to Selectors?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Domenic: what defines that `:root, :--blah { background:lime }` suddenly works if not a change to Selectors?
Domenic: what defines that :root, :--blah { background:lime } suddenly works if not a change to Selectors?

content.body: annevk: My understanding is any time anyone <dfn>s a pseudo-class, it now works. There's no master list of pseudo-classes; even Selectors is just a bunch of <dfn>s.
content.formatted_body: annevk: My understanding is any time anyone <dfn>s a pseudo-class, it now works. There's no master list of pseudo-classes; even Selectors is just a bunch of <dfn>s.
